text: thank you summer! im running an editions build right now, but will take a spin through this later! appreciate it
No problem! After running it for a while, can you poke through the device usage stats and connectivity stats and tell me if you see anything unusual? I’m still working out the kinks in those areas.
of course! although each time i look im like “i cannot POSSIBLY be spending this much time on instagram” :wink:
Hahaha, right?

are you good to go on moving forward with the work evans mentioned in our standup yesterday? (moving us towards being able to visualize data by day vs. overall time since running)? or do you expect to need to do some more clean up before you can shift to that?
I’ve already started working on that. It should be no problem, assuming the data I’m collecting is actually accurate.
awesome! just let me know if you run into any blockers so we can keep that moving! :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U026PHQ3J> (or <@U1ZG1UCAK> or <@U2H61EJSG> if possible) - can you give me a quick explanation of the fix made for the memory leak issue that came from the jen stark gif?
oh!
yes
bonnie “needs" for the tdd :slightly_smiling_face:

there were two: one was related to previewing the wallpaper. Basically when in preview mode, the renderer in Collections wasn’t releasing the memory for the images that it was displaying immedately. So it caused an issue for some larger screen devices.
the other was an optimization
amateur question - <@U2H61EJSG> do i have to have the Gauge wallpaper set as my bg in order for the app to collect usage data?
So the second one disposes the frames of the gif more aggressively to ensure lower upward pressure on memory usage for very detailed or large Bitmaps that are being drawn to the screen
<@U0260V1BX> yes
ok. going to work on making a better looking placeholder soon :slightly_smiling_face:
we might be able to use the trends renderer and actually display real data soon
Using the existing trends render sounds like a good idea
that would be d o p e
Once I’m done allowing the user to view filter data by day, week, month etc I can start messing around with that
lets at least try to match the colors / style of the inspo image kat provided for short term
but melissa - totally think its worth putting some thought here
(and to trends visualizations too, if you have any ideas based on that deck)
actually summer
or maybe once evans starts playing with that we can all connect and adjust as needed to be the coolest
thanks <@U026PHQ3J> - updating TDD with that info now
it might make more sense to not even bother modifying the data collection app UI at this point
I was simply thinking of adding some switch views that when toggled will filter the data by day, week, etc. It’s not much of a UI change
ok
no big deal
ill help you get the renderer ported when we’re back in the office at some point
its pretty easy
the renderers are fairly portable its just a matter of wiring up the right data
That would be excellent! I still don’t really understand renderers
it takes a lot of time to transition over to GL thinking
so don’t sweat it
you’ll get there
I’m still having issues with the data though, so I will need to work out those kinks first. Unexpected shutdowns and reboots screw with device usage and connectivity stats
yeah. data is more important
yeah i wouldnt focus on the current UI for too long - its all gonna be tossed eventually, and kats not too interested in this
hey <@U1ZG1UCAK> guess what?
what?
heard back from aiden!
and...
hahah
:grimacing:
no he basically said we did it wrong
but then evans reminded him we DIDN'T
i torched him
however i found something that needs to be updated
evans torched him
lol
:tada:
i sent him some leading emails before i told him why he was wrong
:fire:

he accused us of not templating out everything + provided a file. i DID find one thing i think needs to be templated out though - do you mind doing a pass through to confirm the rest + updating if needed?
or - let me know if you are the middle of something
I'm available
the one i found:
<string name="nav_title_about_trends" description="This text is a label to a button that users can tap to read more about Google Trends">About Trends</string>
(trends should be templated out)
ah... ok.
also i will forward you the email for fun
:slightly_smiling_face:
CHIEF TORCH OFFICER
okay, does Aiden need updated files or was he pointing out things we need to fix, just because?
he was asking for updates
the zip you sent was fine
:eyes:
oh yeah - the point is - you did a great job!
lol
i think he glanced at it and saw product names (but in the descriptions where they are okay to be)
midori - im reviewing from his txt from the bottom up to see if i catch anything else that needs to be updated (just in case you are looking at now as well)
also, are we even using that string
yes in overflow menu i believe
gotcha
^^ true
<@U13GPDA1F> - I didn't get the attachment in the email
<@U13GPDA1F|lynsey> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/lynsey/F3PN9N065/brands.txt|brands.txt>

text: (i think he search XMLs for product names and these came up - so likely way easier to go through these than anything else)
i only found one other that id love you to confirm - <string name=“tos”> thats got a bunch of shit in there, but maybe a non-issue?
That one isn't templated, but it could be
no
ok
and... oof that email is condescending :face_with_rolling_eyes:
I feel so left out!
Hahaha
okay then maybe its just the ONE “about trends” string unless you found something else
<@U2H61EJSG>! how are you doing over there?

I’m doing just fine! I added some switches so that you can now filter the device usage data to see stats since the wallpaper was first enabled, from the last 24 hours, or the last week. Still working out a few kinks though.
nice!
